required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety Extension Study in Patients With Erythropoietic Protoporphyria (EPP)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Safety Extension Study in Patients With Erythropoietic Protoporphyria (EPP)

brief_summary.textblock: The main objectives of the study were to evaluate the safety and tolerability of afamelanotide by measuring treatment emergent adverse events (AEs) and to determine whether afamelanotide can improve the quality of life of EPP patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life Measured Using the EPP-quality of Life Questionnaire (EPP-QoL).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 60, Day 120, Day 180 or early termination (ET) (if applicable)
primary_outcome.description: The EPP-QoL is presented as 15 questions aiming at measuring how the condition has affected the patient over the last 2 months. Each question is answered on a categorical scale. The maximum score is calculated by summing the score of each question resulting in a maximum of 100 and a minimum of 0. The higher the score, the better the quality of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life Measured Using the Dermatology Life Quality Index Questionnaire (DLQI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 60, Day 120, Day 180 or early termination (ET) (if applicable)
primary_outcome.description: The DLQI questionnaire consists of 10 questions, each answered on a categorical scale. The DLQI is calculated by summing the score of each question resulting in a maximum of 30 and a minimum of 0. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

outcome.title: Change in Quality of Life Measured Using the EPP-quality of Life Questionnaire (EPP-QoL).
outcome.description: The EPP-QoL is presented as 15 questions aiming at measuring how the condition has affected the patient over the last 2 months. Each question is answered on a categorical scale. measure.description: The DLQI questionnaire consists of 10 questions, each answered on a categorical scale. The DLQI is calculated by summing the score of each question resulting in a maximum of 30 and a minimum of 0. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

reported_events.desc: The adverse event reported below is an adverse event assessed to be related to the study drug by the investigator.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
